jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

4B03D19D4C1849F3B179038C6F18B3A8.description:
Identify charities and
Catholic services that provide
goods and services to those in
need.

75AAFE6B9FDA43AFB9392C927440838A.description:
Identify workers who provide
public goods and services in
the community.

1422FD5F3BE54AE09A3DF0C5354B02AA.description: Understand the impact of government policies and decisions on production and consumption in the economy. Understand the moral implications of policies and decisions on production and consumption. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7

1FDEEDDF6DB94B58A0099D8D5715C6E8.description:
Determine why God wants us
to treat each other fairly.

670C193A6AD846F099E12B351A4BFD77.description:
List items that students use
but do not make themselves.

36F86EF502B846B39AF115F08EFA42E7.description:
Identify exchanges that
students have made with the
use of money.

29C3B25614C84FC2B648D6ACE691D3C1.description:
Identify exchanges that
students have made without
the use of money.

C8E4707E3E5B40ADA0A50D7CB7912BF6.description: Understanding trade as an exchange of goods or services. Understand moral values behind the understanding of trade as an exchange of goods and services. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7

05A0549C7A574A439181E047305163EB.description:
Tell why God wants us to
make choices that are good
not only for ourselves but for
others.

FB8C3AF1A69F4266B7F5678F0DD174B4.description:
List the resources needed to
make a simple item.

FEB4C57574CB44D98AF798168BA7A8DF.description:
Identify people who produce
goods and services in the
community.

3032CA7F677948DE953F7D216029F8B5.description:
Understand that scarcity necessitates choices by producers. Understand that scarcity necessitates producer choices which have moral implications. Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7        Value and develop a love for the common good and our shared humanity, not just with those around us, but for those who have gone before
and those who will come after us. CSDS2 (7-12 CS)

F23D3D013ACD4C6593FF94A8112CD39E.description:
Tell why God wants us to help
provide for the needs of
others.

E5C0E27C7AC2437D93EC839BF24B3BC0.description:
Make a choice between two
items and tell what was given
up.

6DCC09798D8A48EF8B9F4FDCF178005F.description:
List goods they want and
label them as "wants."

642CAAFB2FCD4FBE912465DA9BF8A626.description:
Identify a choice students
have made when buying a
good or service.

A091EC9570154F2CBED58352217FC1A1.description: Understand that scarcity necessitates choices by consumers. Understand that scarcity necessitates consumer choices which have moral implications. Discriminate between what is positive in the world, what needs to be transformed, and what injustices must be overcome. CSDS4   Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions. CSIS7

D9939876B9324B4F9FBF0268301EBF4A.description:
Identify workers they see at
school, in the parish and in
the community.

358516A2611E4C6FB78A04B7C8D5586D.description:
Describe jobs they do at
home; tell how these
responsibilities serve God.

B771779B6C5346F6A8CD63B55808FFDF.description:
Suggest a way in which a
scarce item could be
distributed (e.g., one jump
rope, 3 children); explain why
God wants all people to be
treated fairly.

BF687DE008B042BBBAA1EC6C29AF6B0A.description:
Describe a choice they have
made and explain why they
had to make a choice.

D680F36678EF48248C8488306ECF1A6E.description: Understand how different economic systems operate in exchange, production, distribution and consumption of goods and services. Understand the moral consequences of how different economic systems operate in exchange, production, distribution and consumption of goods and services. Identify the motivating values that have informed particular societies and how they correlate with Catholic teaching. CSIS7 (7-12 CS)          Explain how one’s beliefs about God, about humanity, and about material things, affect one’s actions .CSIS7 (K-6 CS)

B6717AA6CC9441EB8ACE3563BEC38718.description: Understand economic systems with an emphasis on the United States. Understand moral aspects of the economic systems of the United States.
